crafting.name: Information
entries: To further increase player customization, interesting loot, and introduce more options for progression besides the next +1 on weapons and armor, Ishiir will feature a crafting system.
Go to interesting places, meet interesting creatures, kill them and make cool stuff out of them.
<hr />

entries.name: Crafting
entries: A crafting check requires 4 things: time, gold, ingredients, and the right tools. A table for all crafting professions can be found below.

To craft, roll three skill checks for the appropriate crafting tools while investing half the item's gold value and the necessary ingredients. The DC for these checks is determined by the item you wish to craft. Otherwise, the base DC is always 10.
If you fail all three, your crafting attempt fails and you expend all materials. If you fail two, your crafting attempt fails, and you expend half of the materials.

If you succeed two rolls, your crafting attempt is successful. If you succeed all three, your crafting attempt is successful and the resulting item is a masterwork, which nets different bonuses depending on the kind of item you were crafting.

You can also add the masterwork property to non-consumable items retroactively. To do so, you must spend half the normal gold cost and time needed to craft the base item. The DC still takes all existing properties into account, if any. If you succeed on all three rolls, you add the masterwork property to the existing item.
<hr />

entries.name: Harvesting
entries: Harvesting ingredients from monsters requires a skill check decided by the DM with a DC of 10 + 1/2 the creature's CR, rounded down. If the harvesting checks surpasses the DC by 5 or more, the ingredient is of pristine quality. If half or more of the required ingredients for a crafting check are of pristine quality, the DC gets reduced by 1. Pristine items are also 1.5 as valuable as regular items of the same kind.

crafting.name: Alchemy
entries: Alchemy requires the {@item Alchemist's Supplies|Ishiir} to make crafting checks.
Items with the masterwork property have their duration doubled. Any die rolls associated with the item are maximized.
Crafting with alchemy takes an amount of hours equal to the DC of the item - 9.
A creature con only have a number of potions equal to their Constitution modifier imbibed at the same time.
<hr />

crafting.name: Armorsmithing
entries: When crafting using the {@item Armorsmith's Tools|Ishiir}, the DC increases based on the material used. Said material also determines which further properties the crafted item can be modified with.
This DC increment applies regardless of whether additional properties are added upon first crafting the item or after the fact.
Crafting time is an amount of days equal to the DC of the item / 2.

To do so, you must spend half the gold cost and time needed for the base item. If you succeed on all three rolls With the exception of items made from basic steel, masterwork items receive a bonus of +1 to their AC.
<hr />
<hr />

entries.caption: Armor Materials
rows: Initiative +2, removes disadvantage on DEX (Stealth) checks and STR requirement
Indestructible, universal crit protection against everything but adamantite, AC +1

entries: <hr />

crafting.name: Cooking
entries: Cooking requires the {@item Cook's Utensils|Ishiir} to make crafting checks. It can be used to craft snacks and full meals. A single crafting produces {@dice 1d8} snacks or enough helpings of a full meal to feed the entire party. A snack can be used at any point, but with a limit of one per turn. A full meal has to be consumed as part of a short or long rest. A character con only consume one meal per rest. The benefits of a snack last until the beginning of your next turn. The benefits of a meal last until the end of the next rest.

A full meal will lose its special properties if it's not consumed within 24 hours after crafting is finished unless it is preserved through magical means such as a {@item Chest of Preserving|Ishiir}. A snack does not lose its properties unless the DM rules that it has gone bad after a longer period of time or through special circumstances or effects.

When crafting using the {@item Cook's Utensils|Ishiir}, the DC increases based on the spices used. Crafting with cooking takes an amount of hours equal to the DC of the item - 9. A masterwork snack maximizes the number of snacks you obtain from this crafting. A masterwork full meal lasts for two rests instead of one.

Many recipes require special ingredients harvested from monsters that are only used for this crafting skill. You can find all of these ingredients in the following table. You can harvest these ingredients using your {@item Cook's Utensils|Ishiir} or by using the {@action Help|Ishiir} action to assist another character in harvesting the creature with the appropriate skill (e.g. {@skill Nature} or {@skill Survival} for beasts).
<hr />

* Sylvan Sugar is specially treated Sylvan Dust. You can only harvest Sylvan Sugar OR Sylvan Dust, but if the creature allows you to harvest multiple Sylvan Dusts, you can decide how much of each you wish to obtain.

** Black Salt is specially treated Spectral Dust. You can only harvest Black Salt OR Spectral Dust, but if the creature allows you to harvest multiple Spectral Dusts, you can decide how much of each you wish to obtain.

entries.name: Grades and Gourmet dishes
entries: Materials harvested from monsters have a grade. The grade of a material is equal to the proficiency bonus of the monster -1. When crafting a full meal with a monster material, you can attempt to craft a gourmet dish.

To do so, add the grade of the monster material to the DC of the full meal. If you successfully craft the full meal and it results in a mastercraft, any character who consumes the meal also regains an additional hit die and has a chance to regain a long rest feature or spell slots (their choice) in addition to the normal effects of the meal.

To do so, the character rolls a {@dice d20}. On a 19 or 20, they regain a single use of a long rest feature or spell slots equaling the grade of the material used to craft the full meal. With each grade above 1 the range for a successful roll improves by 1 (e.g. 18-20 for grade 2, 17-20 for grade 3 etc).
<hr />

crafting.name: Enchanting
entries: Enchanting requires the {@item Enchanter's Supplies|Ishiir} to make crafting checks. It can be used to craft scrolls and wondrous items.
To craft a scroll, you must know the spell and have access to a spell slot of the spell's level. To craft, you expend the spell slot and its material components once.

Crafting a scroll takes an amount of hours equal to the DC -9. Scrolls with the masterwork property can be used by any class without an ability check. The spell save DC for the scroll is that of the crafter (use your highest mental stat for the calculation if you don't have an innate spell save DC).

To craft a wondrous item, you must have access to spell slots of a level equal to the item's DC - 10. This spell slot is expended each week you spend crafting. If the DC of the item is higher it can only be crafted at an appropriate place of power determined by the DM.

You can combine the properties of non-consumable wondrous items with an existing one. In this case, you add the gold cost together. The DC increases by the original DC - 10 for each wondrous item you're adding.
Crafting a wondrous item takes an amount of days equal to the item's DC /2. Wondrous items with the masterwork property receive additional properties determined by the DM.
<hr />
<hr />

entries.caption: Craftable Wondrous Items
rows: {@item Figurine of Wondrous Power: Onyx Dog|Ishiir}
{@item Amulet of Proof against Detection and Location|Ishiir}

crafting.name: Fletching
entries: When crafting using the {@item Fletcher's Tools|Ishiir}, the DC increases based on the material used. Said material also determines which further properties the crafted item can be modified with.
This DC increment applies regardless of whether additional properties are added upon first crafting the item or after the fact.
Crafting time is an amount of day equal to the DC of the item - 9.

With the exception of items made from basic wood, masterwork ammunition receive a bonus of +1 damage, masterwork ranged weapons receive a bonus of +1 to hit. The total enhancement bonus of an item can't exceed +5.
<hr />
<hr />

entries.caption: Weapon Materials
rows: Attack/Damage +1, One addition weaponal die on crit

entries: <hr />

crafting.name: Herbalism
entries: Herbalism requires the {@item Herbalist's Kit|Ishiir} to make crafting checks.
Healing potions with the masterwork property have their die rolls maximized, other masterwork potions have their duration doubled.
If a masterwork potion has neither a duration nor dice, it instead has 2 uses.
Crafting with herbalism takes an amount of hours equal to the DC of the item - 9.
<hr />

crafting.name: Leatherworking
entries: When crafting using the {@item Leatherworker's Tools|Ishiir}, the DC increases based on the material used. Said material also determines which further properties the crafted item can be modified with.
This DC increment applies regardless of whether additional properties are added upon first crafting the item or after the fact.
Crafting time is an amount of days equal to the DC of the item / 2.
With the exception of items made from basic hide or scale, masterwork items receive a bonus of +1 to their AC.
<hr />
<hr />

entries.caption: Armor Materials
rows: Initiative +2, Removes disadvantage on DEX (Stealth) checks and STR requirement
Universal crit protection against everything but adamantite, AC +1

crafting.name: Poisonmaking
entries: Poisonmaking requires the {@item Poisoner's Kit|Ishiir} to make crafting checks.
Items with the masterwork property have their save DC increased by 2. If it has no save DC, it instead deals an additional single die of its damage.
Crafting with poisonmaking takes an amount of hours equal to the DC of the item - 9.
Additionally, if all 3 crafting checks fail, the crafter is subjected to the effect of the poison he wanted to create.
Unless otherwise stated, poisons with a lasting effect have a duration of 1 hour when affecting a creature.
<hr />

entries.caption: Poison Types
rows: Poison makes contact with exposed skin. Remains potent until contact.
First skin contact or when washed off
Poison is inhaled. 10 ft half sphere cloud.
1 minute or when dissipated by strong wind
Taking damage from slashing or piercing weapon coated in poison. Sufficent for 3 weapon hits or 3 pieces of ammunition.

entries: <hr />

crafting.name: Tinkering
entries: Tinkering requires the {@item Tinker's Tools|Ishiir} to make crafting checks.
Items with the masterwork property have their duration doubled.
Crafting with tinkering takes an amount of hours equal to the DC of the item.
Tinkering is essentially free-form crafting, where the player formulates an idea or concept and the DM determines the cost and DC based on that.

crafting.name: Weaponsmithing
entries: When crafting using the {@item Weaponsmith's Tools|Ishiir}, the DC increases based on the material used. Said material also determines which further properties the crafted item can be modified with.
This DC incrementally applies regardless of whether additional properties are added upon first crafting the item or after the fact.
Crafting time is an amount of days equal to the DC of the item / 2.

With the exception of items made from basic steel, masterwork items receive a bonus of +1 to their damage and attack rolls. The parrying dagger instead receives a bonus of +1 to AC. It also uses the properties from the armorsmithing table instead. The total enhancement bonus of an item can't exceed +5.
<hr />
<hr />

entries.caption: Weapon Materials
rows: Initiative +2, removes heavy property but keeps its damage bonus, add finesse property on non-heavy weapons
Indestructible, crit range increased by 1, attack/damage +1

entries: <hr />

entries.caption: Properties
rows: Blessing of Setifor//Blessing of the Pale Knight
{@item Wrath of the Ancients|Ishiir|Wrath of the Ancients (M)}
